Key Match Events: Sri Lanka win by eight wickets with almost half their overs to spare
England lost for the fourth time in five matches
England 156 all out (Wood st Mendis b Theekshana 5)
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and elected to bat
Chris Woakes and Mark Wood showed signs of finding their rhythm
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler admits England hit 'huge low' in World Cup defeat by Sri Lanka
Matthew Mott, England’s Australian coach, says 'unfortunately, we've saved our worst form for this World Cup'
Ben Stokes did his best, hanging in there against the odds
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's net run rate is awful (-1.63)
Sri Lanka win by eight wickets with almost half their overs to spare – 24.2 overs
England’s demise was shocking, though I’m not sure it was surprising
Sri Lanka go up to fifth in the table, ahead of Pakistan
Others: Sri Lanka had four superstars as well as a strong team effort that manifested itself in fine fielding
England had only David Willey playing well, and he’s the one player in their squad who hasn’t just been given a central contract
England’s net run rate is heading from bad to worse
